intro: Brassica oleracea proles atlantica, commonly known as the Atlantic cabbage, is a botanical variant of the cabbage species. It is characterized by its compact, dense head of tightly packed leaves, typically green in color. This variety is native to the coastal regions of the Atlantic, where it has adapted to salty and windy conditions. The plant is an annual, growing to a height of about 30–60 cm, with a short stem and broad, fleshy leaves. It is primarily cultivated for its edible leaves and is a hardy plant that thrives in cooler climates.
